title: Furious flower : seeding the future of African American poetry
subject: American poetry -- 20th century
American poetry -- 21st century
African Americans$$QAfrican Americans -- Poetry
African Americans
American poetry
American poetry -- African American authors
publisher: Evanston, Illinois : Triquarterly Books, Northwestern University Press
description: "Furious Flower: Seeding the Future of African American Poetry is an anthology of poems by more than one hundred award-winning poets, including Jericho Brown, Justin Philip Reed, and Tracy K. Smith, with themed essays on poetics from celebrated scholars such as Kwame Dawes, Meta DuEwa Jones, and Evie Shockley. The Furious Flower Poetry Center is the nation's first academic center for Black poetry. In this eponymous collection, editors Joanne V. Gabbin and Lauren K. Alleyne bring together many of the paramount voices in Black poetry and poetics active today, composing an electrifying mosaic of voices, generations, and aesthetics that reveals the Black narrative in the work of twentieth- and twenty-first-century writers. Intellectually enlightening and powerfully enlivening, Furious Flower explores and celebrates the idea of the Black poetic voice by posing the question, What's next for Black poetic expression?"--Publisher's description.
contributor: Gabbin, Joanne V., editor.$$QGabbin, Joanne V.
Alleyne, Lauren K., editor.$$QAlleyne, Lauren K.
Dove, Rita, writer of foreword.$$QDove, Rita
James Madison University. Furious Flower Poetry Center.$$QJames Madison University. Furious Flower Poetry Center.
Furious Flower Conference (3rd : 2014 : James Madison University)$$QFurious Flower Conference
contents: Foreword / Rita Dove -- Preface / Joanne V. Gabbin and Lauren K. Alleyne -- 1. Collective power -- 2. Black aesthetics -- 3. Pan-African poetics -- 4. Renovation -- 5. Writing the body -- 6. The collective.
